item.title: The whole road is full of deep pot holes!, 25th April
item.description:
The potholes are outside number 8 Salamanca but there are a significant number of small but deep potholes from 4 Salamanca- 12 Salamanca. The potholes are damaging our tyres and making it a struggle to get on and off our driveway, they are also a big risk to the disabled and elderly who tend to use their wheelchairs/ mobility scooters on the road as they can’t always use the pathway but they get stuck in the holes. The whole road needs resurfacing as it didn’t get done when Imjin road and Ladysmith road got resurfaced. The road a dangerous hazard!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Salamanca Road, Oakley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 25th April
item.description:
Pothole x 2 Very Deep 8 inches., smaller than dinner plate size in diameter.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sharp metal sticking out in/over footway from fence - this remains unactioned & unresolved nearly after a year after initially reporting it despite your records stating otherwise - see FixMyStreet ref: 5985705. Think pedestrian! Think avoidable pedestrian injury & subsequent claims/enquiries!, 25th April
item.description:
GET SOMEONE ONTO SITE TO REVIEW & RESOLVE THIS..... Sharp metal sticking out in/over footway from fence - this remains unactioned & unresolved nearly after a year after initially reporting it despite your records stating otherwise - see FixMyStreet ref: 5985705. Think pedestrian! Think avoidable pedestrian injury & subsequent claims/enquiries!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, New Street, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Bollard cover is off and causing a trip hazard/obstruction (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Private trees overhanging footway here - enforcement action required - blind woman hit in face & torso her dog could walk under it - width not there as you've permitted (literally!) parking on the wider part of the footway, pedestrians have to walk near/along back edge & wall (esp when cars driving through to access footway parking spaces - these driver don't care and so people are hurting their eyes & faces here when forced into that position!) - ACT NOW TO SAVE PEDESTRIAN INJURIES & LITIGATIONS, 25th April
item.description:
Private trees overhanging footway here - enforcement action required - blind woman hit in face & torso her dog could walk under it - width not there as you've permitted (literally!) parking on the wider part of the footway, pedestrians have to walk near/along back edge & wall (esp when cars driving through to access footway parking spaces - these driver don't care and so people are hurting their eyes & faces here when forced into that position!) - ACT NOW TO SAVE PEDESTRIAN INJURIES & LITIGATIONS
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -other CW10 problem, 25th April
item.description:
28 day with 2 way traffic lights carriageway edge deterioration 4600x1200x40mm tarmac patch required best out of hours (CW10 Edge Deterioration)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cast iron bollard still missing from footway and still needs reinstating to prevent vehicles cutting through - yes, driving on the footway to get around your 'stopping up' traffic engineering furnatures (I recently saw 2x telecoms contractor vans driving through it with a mother & child pedestrian scared stiff when they thought they were going to get hit - PLEASE ACT TO SAVE LIVES!)., 25th April
item.description:
Rereporting of already registered issue, see FixMyStreet ref: 6640332 and JOB_42553268. This work has NOT been completed despite what your records say, the footway has merely been made safe of voids but vehicles are now cutting through here because you have not replaced the cast iron bollard - funnily enough it was sited there for a reason in the first place, hmmm wonder what that could be!? Let's not be here in another 6+ months re-re-reporting the same thing or worse discussing a KSI detail because GCC did not act...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Street, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Bollard cover is off but not causing a trip hazard/obstruction (Non illuminating bollard or post)
